result.execSummary:
The defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: All applicable costs and surcharges.  To be paid by 2/3/15.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Credit for six (6) months.  TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aveon Terrell Mullen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen in custody.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information received and filed.    On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Posession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), a Misd.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Court ordered the defendant to serve 6 months in the HOC with credit for 6 months time served.
All applicable costs and surcharges to be paid by 2-3.15 failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form

Per the parties request, case is scheduled for the speedy disposition calendar on 12/05/2014 at 01:30 p.m., in Room 509 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Negotiations ongoing.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 12/17/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert in court, defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 10/22/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert in court, defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen not in court, in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has been revoked.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 9/5/2014 at 9:00 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  State informed the court that they will not use a video in trial, if it can not be found.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert in court, defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen not in court, in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 8/20/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defendant no longer wishes to plead guilty and requests a jury trial.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the Safety Building.    Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark, Br. 17.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 3.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 08-06-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen in court with attorney Joseph E Schubert.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-16-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph E Schubert in court, defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen not in court, in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).  FILE NOT IN COURT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).
  Attorney Sargent informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Stephen A Sargent in court, Defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen not in court, in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the House of Correction for purposes of this hearing. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen in court with attorney Edgar Lin for Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen in custody.  Antonella Aleman for Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW) INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Aveon Terrell Mullen in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
